page.title: 17Lifeboat.
page.content: Eastbourne has had a lifeboat since 1822. The R.N.L.I.was founded in 1824. The first lifeboat was powered by oars. At the moment the lifeboat's name is{The Duke of Kent.}There are ten crew members, but only seven of the crew can be on the lifeboat at one time, though five is the maximum crew. The present crew are:- {G.Cole Cox'an/Mechanic { D.Corke 2nd Cox'an { C.Burden { R.Billich B.Delauney { T.Walker M.Charlton} The Duke of Kent is a Rother type lifeboat, 37 ft. long. The Inshore lifeboat is a "D" class boat costing Â£7,750. In 1984 the R.N.L.I. cost over Â£18 million pounds to run. On average 3 lives are saved every day by all the lifeboats in England.
